resources.string: Requires root or Dhizuku; root recommended
You can set the user limit in this dialog. Creating too many users may overflow your device memory.

The app will hide itself after all operations finish. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

Important: if used without root, this option only hides the app from the launcher; the app remains visible in settings. This option is incompatible with device admin rights when used with Dhizuku.

The app will clear itself after all operations finish. Requires Dhizuku permission or root.

Important: the app will remain installed on the device. This option is incompatible with device admin rights when used with Dhizuku.

The app will clear its data after all operations finish. After clearing the app\'s data, the app can only hide itself (see "Hide itself" option). In contrast to the "Clear itself" option, the app\'s permissions will be left intact.
The app will start destroying your data when you enter the duress password (NOT the PIN). This is the same password you use to unlock the app. Requires the accessibility service to be running.
Do you want to install Dhizuku?
You need to install the Dhizuku app and grant it device owner rights.
The device can\'t be booted into safe mode now.
The device can be booted into safe mode now.
Failed to change user switcher status
The UI for user switching was disabled as well.
Failed to change user switch status
You can open user settings now
Safe boot is disabled. Do you really want to enable safe boot? An adversary may use safe boot to circumvent the protection offered by this app.

Safe boot is enabled. Do you really want to disable safe boot? An adversary may use safe boot to circumvent the protection offered by this app. Please use root or ADB to disable safe boot instead of Dhizuku.
Multiuser UI is enabled. Do you want to disable it?
Multiuser UI is disabled. Do you want to enable it?

User switcher UI is enabled. Do you want to disable it? It\'s recommended to disable the UI for switching users whenever you don\'t need it, because otherwise an adversary may use the pull-down settings menu to get a list of your profiles from the lock screen.

User switcher UI is disabled. Do you want to enable it? It\'s recommended to disable the UI for switching users whenever you don\'t need it, because otherwise an adversary may use the pull-down settings menu to get a list of your profiles from the lock screen.

User switching is currently prohibited. Do you want to allow it and enable the UI for switching users? It\'s recommended to disable the UI for switching users whenever you don\'t need it, because otherwise an adversary may use the pull-down settings menu to get a list of your profiles from the lock screen.\nImportant: use this method only if enabling the user switcher UI option didn\'t work.

User switching is currently allowed. Do you want to prohibit it and disable the UI for switching users? It\'s recommended to disable the UI for switching users whenever you don\'t need it, because otherwise an adversary may use the pull-down settings menu to get a list of your profiles from the lock screen.\nImportant: use this method only if disabling the user switcher UI option didn\'t work.
This app requires the accessibility service for various actions. Click "OK" and go to "Installed Services > Island (or Shelter)" if you want to enable or disable the accessibility service.

After all operations complete, the app will run the TRIM command to inform the drive which areas are no longer in use and can be erased. Enabling this option may reduce the likelihood of recovering deleted data. Requires root rights or Shizuku rights.

Important: it is recommended to use this option with root privileges. If you use this option with Shizuku permission while the Shizuku service is inactive, TRIM will not run.

The app will wipe all user data, or all data on the device if called from the main user. For wiping all device data (calling wipe from the main user) with device admin rights, Android 13 or lower is required.

The app will destroy itself after all operations finish. Requires root rights or Shizuku permission.

Important: it is recommended to use this option with root privileges. If you use this option with Shizuku permission while the Shizuku service is inactive, the app will not be able to destroy itself. In this case, the "Hide app" option can help by hiding the app from the launcher.

The app will start destroying data when a USB device or USB accessory is connected. Connecting the device to a computer in charging-only mode will also be counted. Don\'t forget to disable this option if you want to connect any USB device without risking data loss! Requires the accessibility service to be running.
After reaching the maximum number of wrong password attempts (default: 10), the app will start destroying your data. Requires device admin rights.
Select the number of consecutive wrong password attempts required to start data clearing. Enabling this option will protect the device against brute-force attacks. Default: 10
Set the maximum latency between clicks in a sequence (in milliseconds) for usual mode. Default: 1500 ms.
Set the maximum latency between clicks in a sequence (in milliseconds) for root mode. Default: 500 ms.
Set the number of consecutive power button clicks required to launch data destruction
Destroy data on power button clicks?

If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s power button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data.

Requires the accessibility service and root rights.

If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s power button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data.

Using this option without root rights is deprecated for good reason. Consider using the "Run on volume button" option if you can\'t grant root rights.

In legacy mode, the app counts screen on/off state changes caused by those clicks rather than button clicks directly. There is a delay between a click and the screen state change, and additional clicks made during this delay will not be counted. Therefore, you should not click too fast; that\'s why the default max delay between clicks for this mode is high. This method is prone to false positives and false negatives.

Requires the accessibility service.
If you activate this option, the device will reboot on USB connection, entering BFU mode and making it more difficult to compromise the device. Requires root or Dhizuku.
Do you want to grant root rights?

The app needs root rights to perform the most restricted operations reliably — for example, to silently uninstall itself.

Warning: granting root rights makes data destruction much more stealthy, but unlocking the bootloader and rooting your device can make it less secure against attacks by advanced hackers. If you think you may be targeted by such attackers or you don\'t need stealthy deletion, do not grant root permissions. If, however, you are mainly concerned about searches of your device and an obvious deletion could put you in danger, you may grant root privileges and configure the app to delete data stealthily.
Open your root manager to revoke root rights for this app

Do you want to allow screenshots for this app? If screenshots are allowed, the Android system can take automatic screenshots of this app (used to display the app preview in recent apps). These screenshots can be viewed by an attacker with root access. Disabling screenshots can also help against spyware.
You need to provide root or Dhizuku rights to enable this function

Deprecated option — use "Set logs status" instead.

Do you want to disable the logd service on device boot? Doing so will prevent an adversary from using logs to recover a history of destructive actions. Logd will be re-enabled on device reboot if you disable this option or uninstall the app. Requires root rights.

Deprecated option — use "Set logs status" instead.

Do you want to disable the logd service when starting data deletion? Doing so will prevent an adversary from using logs to recover a history of destructive actions. Logd will be re-enabled on device reboot. Requires root rights.
Are you sure you want to start data destruction? The app will destroy selected data (files, profiles, etc.) and perform selected actions (run TRIM, stop logging, etc.).
Set the delay between locking the phone\'s screen and rebooting. Rebooting moves the phone to BFU and erases encryption keys from memory.

When locked, the device waits for some time for you to unlock it. If you don\'t unlock it, the device will reboot. That will move the device into BFU mode and remove encryption keys from memory, making your device safer.
Move device to BFU on lock
The UI for switching users will be disabled automatically on device boot. This prevents discovery of your profiles via the pull-down settings menu.
The UI for switching users will be disabled automatically when the screen locks. This prevents discovery of your profiles via the pull-down settings menu.
Requires root or Dhizuku, accessibility service, Android 9+
Requires root, Shizuku, or Dhizuku + accessibility service

You are using not a test-only version of the app. That version has the drawback that the self-destruct option is not compatible with administrator privileges. It is recommended to install the test-only version.
You need to provide root rights to select this option
Destroy data on power button clicks? (legacy)
Set the number of consecutive volume button clicks required to launch data destruction
Set the maximum latency between clicks in a sequence (in milliseconds) for the volume button. Default: 500 ms.
Destroy data on volume up button clicks?
If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s volume up button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data. Requires the accessibility service.
Destroy data on volume down button clicks?
If you activate this option, pressing the phone\'s volume down button a certain number of times in a row will delete the data. Requires the accessibility service.
Logs are enabled. Do you want to disable them? Disabling logs will prevent an adversary from using log data to recover a history of destructive actions.
Logs are disabled. Do you want to enable them?
Developer settings are enabled. Do you want to hide them?
Developer settings are hidden. Do you want to unhide them?

These settings will change device behavior in ways an adversary might notice. This may make an attacker suspect you used Android AntiForensic Tools. For each setting in this section (except Legacy and Questionable), instructions are provided on how to reproduce the same setting manually. We recommend memorizing them and repeating them to an attacker if questioned.

• Enable developer settings following this instruction
• Open developer settings
• Find "Logger buffer sizes" and set it to "off"
• Find "Store logger data persistently on device" and set it to "off"

Please use root or ADB to disable safe boot instead of Dhizuku.

• Download the SDK Platform Tools on your PC

• Unzip the archive

• On your mobile device, unlock developer settings

• Open Developer options and enable USB debugging

• Connect the device and allow USB debugging for your PC

• Open a command prompt and run: <path-to-platform-tools>/adb shell settings put global safe_boot_disallowed 1

• Get root rights

• Download a terminal emulator, for example Termux

• Open the emulator and run: su

• Then run: setprop fw.max_users <number-of-users>

After reaching the maximum number of wrong password attempts (default: 10), the app will start destroying your data. Requires the accessibility service.

Warning: this brute-force detection method is experimental and cannot detect every 5th wrong password attempt. In practice that means if you set the limit to 5 failed attempts, the app might not detect the 5th failure - it may only trigger after the 6th attempt.

This method can also fail on custom ROMs or devices using uncommon languages. If this approach doesn\'t work for you, use the alternative method that requires admin rights.
You need to grant admin rights to select this option
You need to start the accessibility service to select this option
Do you want to install Shizuku?
You need to install the Shizuku app and activate it. I recommend downloading pixincreate\'s fork because self-activation works better in that version.
Open the Shizuku app and revoke Shizuku permissions manually
Do you want to hide android system notification about accessibility service usage? This notification can reveal to the enemy the presence of Android Antiforensic Tools on your device
